body: # Indent.txt Turn your indented notes into HTML ## How to use ### Sublime Text 2 See [indent.txt-sublime](http://github.com/Harrison-M/indent.txt-sublime) ### Command line python indenttxt.py inputfile outputfile Parses inputfile using the Indent.txt parser and saves the result to outputfile ## Formatting Examples of all formatting marks can be found in test.txt with the results in output.html * Prefixing a line with a single asterisk (*) will wrap the item in an <em> tag * Prefixing a line with two asterisks (**) will wrap the item in a <strong> tag ## Like Indent.txt? ## License MIT ## Coming soon: * More formatting * Automatic table of contents * Mark lines as Todo.txt items
name: Indent.txt
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: A notetaking utility inspired by my own notetaking habits, Jade, and Todo.txt
